node.title: Flooding kills eight in Malaysia as rescue crews struggle to keep up with calls for help
node.alt: Rescuers and soldiers evacuate villagers on a boat on a flood-hit road
node.description: Selangor police report eight people have been found dead, as the government faces criticism for slow rescue operations.
node.content:
["At least eight people have died in floods that have ravaged Malaysia, where the government is facing\u00a0criticism from the public and opposition politicians\u00a0over its rescue efforts.", "Floods are common on the eastern coast of Malaysia during the annual monsoon season between October and March, but unusually heavy rainfall that started on Friday has put a strain on emergency services across the country.", "Malaysia has mobilised its army and other security agencies across seven states, with the worst flooding in Selangor, the country's wealthiest and most populous region.", "Selangor police reported eight people had been found dead due to the floods on Monday, according to state news agency Bernama.", "They included four in Taman Sri Muda, a neighbourhood in the district of Shah Alam, where many people were still believed to be trapped in homes and apartment buildings as rescue efforts were hampered by a lack of boats and manpower.", "More than 32,000 displaced people from Selangor had\u00a0been moved into temporary shelters as of Monday, the state's Chief Minister said on Twitter.", "", "
Videos posted on social media showed overflowing rivers, landslides, and cars submerged on abandoned streets.
", "But it is unclear how many more remain to be rescued, with communication lines cut off in many parts of the state.", "Opposition politicians\u00a0on Monday criticised authorities for the delay in response.", "\"Tonight will be the third night, people are still screaming for boats,\" politician\u00a0Hannah Yeoh of the Democratic Action Party told reporters in parliament.", "", "
The government has faced criticism for the slow response.(AP:\u00a0Vincent Thian)
", "Prime Minister Ismail Sabri Yaakob said in a statement on Monday he had ordered all agencies to conduct \"more aggressive\" operations to help those affected in Taman Sri Muda.", "Taman Sri Muda resident Sazuatu Remly, 43, and her family were rescued by friends on Monday\u00a0after being trapped in their home for more than two days.", "\"Help from the government never came for us.\u00a0We only got help from the parents of the children I was taking care of,\" she said.", "", "
It is unknown how many people still need assistance.(AP:\u00a0Vincent Thian)
", "Reuters"]
